text.section: Subject to the limitations in this section, the State Board shall waive the examination requirements of this subtitle for an individual who holds a local license.

The State Board shall grant a waiver under this section only if the applicant:
pays the application fee established by the Board under § 6-205 of this title;
provides adequate evidence that the applicant:
meets the qualifications otherwise required by this subtitle; and
is licensed in a local jurisdiction after:
passing, in that local jurisdiction, an examination that is equivalent to the examination for which the applicant is seeking the waiver; and
meeting, in that local jurisdiction, requirements that are equivalent to the licensing requirements of this subtitle; and
submits a statement from the local jurisdiction certifying:
the applicant is in good standing with the local jurisdiction;
the applicant obtained the local license by taking an examination equivalent to the examination given by the State Board; and
the date of the local examination.
An initial State license that is obtained under this section may not be reinstated unless the requirements of § 6-312 of this subtitle are met.
